newsitem.title: INDIA: India celebrates "last remnants of colonial rule".
newsitem.headline: India celebrates "last remnants of colonial rule".

text.p: India, whose freedom 50 years ago marked the beginning of the end of the British empire, has congratulated China before it takes back Hong Kong and ends colonial rule in Asia.

"We, in India, having experienced a colonial past, fully understand the joyous sentiments of the Chinese people on this occasion, as the last remnants of colonial rule in Asia are ended," Prime Minister Inder Kumar Gujral said in a letter to Chinese Premier Li Peng.
The letter, dated July 24, was released on Monday by the Foreign Ministry.

Gujral said Hong Kong was a major international trade and financial centre that has played a unique role in promoting economic cooperation between India and China, which fought a brief border war in 1962.

"The continued prosperity of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region would be of mutual benefit to our two countries," he said, referring to the separate political and economic system that China has pledged to protect.
Gujral said the Indian community was an integral part of Hong Kong and that he expected it to play a significant role in its future development.

"We look forward to further strengthening our links with the Hong Kong Special Administration Region. This will also contribute to the growing relationship of constructive cooperation between our two countries," the Indian leader said.
India will celebrate its 50th anniversary of independence from Britain on August 15.
